request.js

Summary
request.js
Functions
$getPageDirGet the path to the pageDir
$loadLoads and executes JavaScript files

$getMethodGet the HTTP method used on this request

$getCurrentPageGet the current page path assuming the application.pageDir is root.
$getRequestURLGet the requested URL
$getCurrentPageUriGet the current page with .js removed
$getPagePathGet the path of the currentPage with pageDir as root

$getExtraPathGet the rest of the path after the path of the current page

$headCSSIncludes a css file in the head element

$getInstanceGet an object instance by name
$requireSSLRedirects to the ssl url of the requested page

Functions

$getPageDir

var $getPageDir = function()

Get the path to the pageDir

$load

var $l = $load = function(file)

Loads and executes JavaScript files

Parameters

fileThe file to be loaded

$

var $ = function(str)

Just like JQuery!  Find an element or elements in the current document by selector.  Runs the jsoup Element.select method on the element in the current context.  If html is passed in it will be parsed into a jsoup element.

Parameters

strThe selector or html to be parsed into a jsoup element

$redirect

var $redirect = function(loc)

Sends a temporary redirect response to the client using the specified redirect location URL.

Parameters

locthe redirect location URL

Throws

java.io.IOExceptionIf an input or output exception occurs
java.lang.IllegalStateExceptionIf the response was committed or if a partial URL is given and cannot be converted into a valid URL

$getPageParams

var $getPageParams = function(checkJson)

Get the page parameters as an object.  Each key in the object is a parameter passed in on the request.

Returns

The object containing the parameter keys and values

$setPageParam

var $setPageParams = function(params)

set a page paramter for this request

$getRequestBody

var $getRequestBody = function()

Get the request body as a string

Returns

The request body as a string

$getMethod

var $getMethod = function()

Get the HTTP method used on this request

Returns

The HTTP method used on this request.  See Methods.

$getCurrentDir

var $getCurrentDir = function()

Get the current directory path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

Returns

The current directory path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

$getCurrentPage

var $getCurrentPage = function()

Get the current page path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

Returns

The current page path assuming the application.pageDir is root.

$getRequestURL

var $getRequestURL = function()

Get the requested URL

Returns: The requested URL

var $getCurrentPageUri = function()

Get the current page with .js removed

Returns

The current page with .js removed

$getPagePath

var $getPagePath = function(jsPage)

Get the path of the currentPage with pageDir as root

Returns

The path of the currentPage with pageDir as root

$getRealPath

var $getRealPath = function()

Get the full file system path to the current page

Returns

The full file system path to the current page

$getExtraPath

var $getExtraPath = function()

Get the rest of the path after the path of the current page

Returns

The rest of the path after the path of the current page

$getPageSource

var $getPageSource = function()
Get the current page source as a stringgreat for the examples site

$source

var $source = function()

This is the source widget for example pages

Just add a call to the end of your page, and see what happens

$execute

var $e = $execute = function(jsPage,
c)

Loads the page into the document object and runs the page javascript

Examples

These all do the same thing

$e("/recover.js");
$e("/recover.html");
$e("/recover");

Parameters

jsPagePath to the page that will be executed with pageDir as root.

$forward

var $f = $forward = function(jsPage)

Forwards the request to the specified page

Parameters

jsPageThe page to be forwarded to with application.pageDir as root

$include

var $i = $include = function(jspage)

Get the generated content from a page and add it’s head element to the current page

Parameters

jspagethe path tho the page with application.pageDir as root, or relative path from current page

Returns

The document element (body)

$json

var $j = $json = function(obj,
replacer)

Send an object as the HTTP response in JSON format

Parameters

objthe object to send in the HTTP response

$doc

var $d = $doc = function(el)

Send an Element as the HTTP response in HTML format

Parameters

elthe element to send

$headJS

var $headJS = function(path)

Includes a js file in the head element

Parameters

pathThe path to the js file relative to pageDir

$headCSS

var $headCSS = function(path)

Includes a css file in the head element

Parameters

pathThe path to the css file relative to pageDir

$api

var $api = function(actions)

Set up a simple api page that uses the url as a key to the method called.

Example

Say the path to the page is /api/user.  You will then have a user.js file.  If you want an add method you would call /api/user/add from the client, and in the user.js file you would have...

$api({
   add: function() {
       //add a user here
       var user = new User($getRequestBody());
       //Do some validation
       user.save();
   }
});

Parameters

actionsan object containing a mapping of action names to functions

$getInstance

var $getInstance = function(type)

Get an object instance by name

Parameters

typeA string with the name of the type to instantiate

Returns

An object instance

$requireSSL

var $requireSSL = function()

Redirects to the ssl url of the requested page
